intro: Phyllamphora mirabilis, commonly known as the golden star moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, branching structure and vibrant yellow-green coloration, which is due to the presence of chlorophyll and other pigments. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or on rocky substrates. Its reproductive structures, known as sporangia, are borne on specialized stalks called setae. Phyllamphora mirabilis plays a vital role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its native habitats.
